definition: to buy/to acquire/to add to one's possessions

sentences.english: No. You know how much it can cost to furnish an apartment?
sentences.chinese: 那不行。你知道添置一间房的家具得花多少钱？

sentences.english: Placing banner advertisements on other webpages is a common form of e-promotion.
sentences.chinese: 在网页上添置广告栏是最普遍的一种促销。

sentences.english: Acquire for this need additional backup disk drive, in case the discharge outside data.
sentences.chinese: 为此需要添置额外备份磁碟机，以防数据外泄。

sentences.english: Her father pays for her rent and board but Lucy keeps herself in clothes.
sentences.chinese: 露西的父亲负担她的吃住，她自己则挣钱添置衣服。

sentences.english: She has replenished a leather [fur] coat recently.
sentences.chinese: 她最近添置了一件皮袄。

sentences.english: We're going to put in some new furniture.
sentences.chinese: 我们还打算添置一些新家具。

sentences.english: Our office was refurnished with new furniture.
sentences.chinese: 我们的办公室添置了新家具。

sentences.english: We're redecorating and are going to add some things.
sentences.chinese: 我们在正装修，准备添置一些东西。

sentences.english: She quit buying plastic ware for her kitchen. She shopped for local produce.
sentences.chinese: 她没有为厨房添置塑料制品，只买当地生产的东西。

sentences.english: The best thing to do would be to have a humidifier at home.
sentences.chinese: 最好的办法就是为家里添置一台加湿器。

sentences.english: And then purchase a set of audio enthusiast.
sentences.chinese: 再添置一套发烧级的音响。

sentences.english: Her father pays her rent and board but she keeps herself in clothes.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲供给她房租和膳费，但她自己赚钱添置衣服。

sentences.english: The other day I bought myself a new pair of pant.
sentences.chinese: 前几天我给自己添置了一条新裤子。

sentences.english: Thou shalt spent most of thy money on toys and gifts for me.
sentences.chinese: 你应该倾其所有为我添置玩具和礼物。

sentences.english: So I have begun reviewing what I added to the pile.
sentences.chinese: 我开始一件一件地回顾当初添置进来的物品。

sentences.english: You can add in accessories whenever you want.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在需要的时候再添置这些物品。

definition: expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
